title: ericsson-scp

ericsson-scp:scp-function.description: Configuration settings for the Service Communication Proxy NF

nf-instance.description: The SCP instance defines the behavior of the SCP NF as well as the NRF registration behavior

nf-peer-info.description: Defines the required data for 3gpp-Sbi-NF-Peer-Info header in a global level

out-message-handling.description: A switch to define the header handling in a global level

nf-instance-id.description: A Universally Unique IDentifier in the string representation defined in RFC 4122. The canonical representation uses lower case characters. The following is an example of a UUID in string representation: f81d4fae-7dec-11d0-a765-00a0c91e6bf6 Setting this property is optional. It has a meaning for how the SCP registers in its NRF(s): If not set, an automatically generated NF instance ID (a different one for each NRF group) is used for the registration. If set, this is used for the registration rather than the automatically generated NF instance IDs of the NRF groups.

dns-profile.description: Settings for DNS resolution of producers.

ip-family-resolution.description: IP family for the DNS resolution of an FQDN

dns-profile-ref.description: Reference to a defined dns-profile that will be used for DNS resolution on producers of all nf-pools.

ingress-connection-profile.description: Connection profile for ingress traffic cases

max-connection-duration.description: The maximum duration of an incoming TCP connection. The duration is defined as a period since a connection was established. Default value zero means that no time limit is imposed

hpack-table-size.description: Maximum table size (in octets) that the encoder is permitted to use for the dynamic HPACK table. Valid values range from 0 to 2147483647 (2^31 - 1). 0 effectively disables header compression.

max-concurrent-streams.description: Maximum concurrent streams allowed for peer on one HTTP/2 connection. If the limit is reached, it is treated as stream error

connection-idle-timeout.description: The period in which there are no active HTTP requests. When the idle timeout is reached the connection will be closed. To disable idle timeouts explicitly set this to 0.

probes.description: Maximum number of keepalive probes to send without response before deciding the connection is dead

time.description: The number of seconds a connection needs to be idle before keep-alive probes start being sent

interval.description: The number of seconds between keep-alive probes

dscp-marking.description: DSCP value used for IP packets sent over this connection

egress-connection-profile.description: Connection profile for egress traffic cases

hpack-table-size.description: Maximum table size (in octets) that the encoder is permitted to use for the dynamic HPACK table. Valid values range from 0 to 2147483647 (2^31 - 1). 0 effectively disables header compression.

max-requests.description: The maximum number of requests that can be outstanding per worker pod to all members of a pool

max-pending-requests.description: The maximum number of requests per worker pod that can be waiting for establishment of a connection

max-connections.description: The maximum number of connections per worker pod that can be established to all members of a pool

max-connection-duration.description: The maximum duration of an outgoing TCP connection. The duration is defined as a period since a connection was established. Default value zero means that no time limit is imposed

max-concurrent-streams.description: Maximum concurrent streams allowed for peer on one HTTP/2 connection. If the limit is reached, SCP may queue requests or establish additional connections (as allowed per circuit breaker limits).

tcp-connect-timeout.description: Timeout for setting up a new connection

connection-idle-timeout.description: The period in which there are no active HTTP requests. When the idle timeout is reached the connection will be closed. To disable idle timeouts explicitly set this to 0.

probes.description: Maximum number of keepalive probes to send without response before deciding the connection is dead

time.description: The number of seconds a connection needs to be idle before keep-alive probes start being sent

interval.description: The number of seconds between keep-alive probes

enable-message-size-measurement.description: A switch that allows the operator to enable or disable upstream traffic counters for message size

dscp-marking.description: DSCP value used for IP packets sent over this connection

local-rate-limit-profile.description: Contains the necessary parameters for local rate limiting to be applied. Referenced from own-network

token-bucket.description: Token bucket configuration based on which local rate limiting will be applied

max-tokens.description: The maximum tokens that the bucket can hold, as well as the number of tokens the bucket initially contains

tokens-per-fill.description: The number of tokens added to the bucket at the beginning of each fill-interval

fill-interval.description: The fill interval at which tokens are added to the bucket, defined in milliseconds

add-response-header.description: Headers to be added on the response to a request that is rejected due to rate limiting

value.description: Value of the header. In case the header is already present, the value is appended.

global-rate-limit-profile.description: Define the necessary parameters for global rate limiting to be applied.

name.description: Name of the rate limit profile.

sustainable-rate.description: The number of incoming requests that can be sustainably received from a peer within an one second interval

max-burst-size.description: The maximum number of the incoming requests, beyond the sustainable rate, that can be received from a peer in a burst

action-reject-message.description: Rejects an http request and sends back a response with an operator defined status code and title with detailed explanation

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem

cause.description: The cause attribute in the json ProblemDetails element of HTTP error messages (according to TS 29.500).

detail.description: A human-readable explanation of the problem. Only used when the format attribute has the value 'json'

format.description: Format of the error message. If the default value 'json' is used, the response body is formatted according to RFC 7807. If the format value used is 'text', a header 'content-type: text/plain' is added in the response body and only the value of the title attribute is stored.

retry-after-header.description: Format of the retry-after header. If the default value 'delay-seconds' is used, the retry-after-header is formatted according to RFC 7231. If the retry-after-header value used is 'HTTP-date', the corresponding format according to RFC 7231 is used. If the value used is 'disabled' then the retry-after-header is disabled

action-drop-message.description: Drops an http request message and the HTTP/2 stream is reset gracefully

message-body-limits.description: Defines the limits for the message body

max-bytes.description: Maximum message body size in bytes

max-leaves.description: Maximum number of leaves in the JSON message body

max-nesting-depth.description: Maximum nesting depth of the leaves in the JSON message body

vtap.description: Defines the required data for traffic tapping

enabled.description: A switch that allows the operator to enable or disable traffic tapping in a global level

vtap-configuration.description: Defines the required settings for traffic tapping

proxy.description: Defines the required data for tapping on the proxy traffic

ingress.description: Defines the configuration data required for tapping ingress traffic

own-network-ref.description: Reference to the own-network the traffic of which is taken into account for tapping

enabled.description: A switch that allows the operator to enable or disable traffic tapping for the specific element

egress.description: Defines the configuration data required for tapping egress traffic

enabled.description: A switch that allows the operator to enable or disable traffic tapping for the specific element

all-nf-pools.description: If present , it applies egress vtap configuration to all nf-pools

nf-pool-ref.description: Reference to the nf-pool the traffic of which is taken into account for tapping

name.description: Name identifying the SLF lookup profile

request-timeout.description: The timeout of SLF interrogation requests

identity-type.description: The type of subscriber identifier based on which messages should be routed

requester-nf-type.description: The NF type of the NF requesting the SLF interrogation (according to TS 29.510)

target-nf-type.description: The NF type of the targeted NF for SLF interrogation (according to TS 29.510)

message-data-ref.description: Reference to message-data MO that defines the data to extract from a message

result-variable-name.description: Variable name to store the outcome of the SLF interrogation

routing-case-identity-not-found.description: Routing case where the execution will continue when the interrogated supi/gpsi is not found in the SLF lookup

routing-case-destination-unknown.description: Routing case where the execution will continue when the SLF interrogation result does not exist

routing-case-identity-missing.description: Routing case where the execution will continue when the subscriber identity cannot be retrieved from the request message

routing-case-lookup-failure.description: Routing case where the execution will continue when the SLF interrogation fails

service-address.description: Listening address of the SCP, referenced in own-network as well as the nf-profile and nf-service sent to the NRF

ipv4-address.description: IPv4 address of the SCP service

ipv6-address.description: IPv6 address of the SCP service

name.description: Name uniquely identifying the service address.

fqdn.description: FQDN of the nf-service, for example chf.op.com

port.description: This port is used to receive non-TLS traffic.

tls-port.description: This port is used to receive TLS traffic.

own-network.description: Definition of an own, internal network of this SCP instance

in-request-screening-case-ref.description: Reference to the request screening case that is applied when a request is received from an NF instance in the own PLMN

out-response-screening-case-ref.description: Reference to the response screening case that is applied when the response is targeting an NF instance in the own PLMN

routing-case-ref.description: Reference to a defined routing case, used for all traffic originating from own PLMN

message-data.description: Data extracted from incoming requests, used in routing rules to determine the appropriate routing action

name.description: Name identifying the message data set

path.description: If present, specifies that the content of the URL path is used as the source

request-header.description: If present, specifies the name of the request header from which to read the content

response-header.description: If present, specifies the name of the response header from which to read the content

header.description: If present, specifies the name of the request or response header from which to read the content depending on if it is used in the request or response path

body-json-pointer.description: If configured, specifies the element that will be extracted from a JSON-formatted body with a JSON-Pointer specification according to RFC 6901

variable-name.description: The name of the variable in which to store the extracted data

extractor-regex.description: Regular expression name captures (?<name>re) used to extract data into the variable 'name'. If the regular expression does not match, all variables are left undefined. The names of named-capturesâ€™ respective variables must begin with a letter and contain only letters, digits, or underscore

request-screening-case.description: Entry point to a list of screening rules which are evaluated in sequence to filter a request message

message-data-ref.description: Reference to defined message-data which has extracted the data to be used in screening rule conditions

screening-rule.description: The screening rules are evaluated in sequence once the request-screening-case is referenced

condition.description: A logical expression which is evaluated using the collected data from incoming requests as stored in message-data, and determines whether the screening-rule shall be executed. If no condition is defined, the screening-rule is always executed

screening-action.description: The screening-actions are executed in sequence once the condition of the screening-rule evaluates to true

action-add-header.description: Adds an HTTP header to a message

name.description: Specifies the header to be added to the request

if-exists.description: Defines the behavior when the header exists

value.description: Specifies the value of the header to be added to the request

action-modify-header.description: Either replaces the value of an existing HTTP header with a new one or prepends/appends a value to the existing value of a header

name.description: Specifies the header to be modified

replace-value.description: Specifies the value to replace the header's old value

replace-from-var-name.description: Specifies the name of the variable from which to fetch the value to replace the header's old value

prepend-value.description: Specifies the value to be prepended to the header's old value

prepend-from-var-name.description: Specifies the name of the variable from which to fetch the value to be prepended to the header's old value

append-value.description: Specifies the value to be appended to the header's old value

append-from-var-name.description: Specifies the name of the variable from which to fetch the value to be appended to the header's old value

action-remove-header.description: Removes an HTTP header from a message

name.description: Specifies the header to be removed from the request

action-drop-message.description: Drops an http request message and the HTTP/2 stream is reset gracefully

action-exit-screening-case.description: Exits from a screening-case and terminates message screening processing

action-reject-message.description: Rejects an http request and sends back a response with an operator defined status code and title with detailed explanation

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem

cause.description: The cause attribute in the json ProblemDetails element of HTTP error messages (according to TS 29.500).

detail.description: A human-readable explanation of the problem. Only used when the format attribute has the value 'json'

format.description: Format of the error message. If the default value 'json' is used, the response body is formatted according to RFC 7807. If the format value used is 'text', a header 'content-type: text/plain' is added in the response body and only the value of the title attribute is stored

request-screening-case-ref.description: The name of the request-screening-case where the execution continues

action-log.description: Logs a user-defined message with the configured log-level

text.description: The text to be used for troubleshooting

max-log-message-length.description: Max length of action-log message; any message longer than the limit will be truncated and only the beginning up until the limit will be kept.

log-level.description: Define the log level for troubleshooting

action-modify-json-body.description: Performs modifications on JSON body elements by either adding new elements, replacing the value of existing elements, appending/prepending strings to existing elements or removing the elements from the JSON body

json-pointer.description: Specifies the path inside the JSON body where an element will be added or modified or removed

add-value.description: Adds a new element to the path specified by the json-pointer attribute. If the element already exists in the JSON body, it provides the possibility to either replace the existing value or not. If the path where the element is to be added does not already exist in the JSON body, it provides the possibility to either create the path and add the element or do nothing and not add the element to the JSON body

value.description: Specifies the value of the element to be added

if-path-not-exists.description: Specifies whether the non-existing path, specified by the json-pointer attribute, will be created and the element will be added or nothing will be done and neither the path nor the element will be added to the JSON body

if-element-exists.description: Specifies whether the value of an existing element will be replaced or not

add-from-var-name.description: Adds a new element to the path specified by the json-pointer attribute. The value of the new element is stored on a variable. If the element already exists in the JSON body, it provides the possibility to either replace the existing value or not. If the path where the element is to be added does not already exist in the JSON body it provides the possibility to either create the path and add the element or do nothing and not add the element to the JSON body

if-path-not-exists.description: Specifies whether the non-existing path, specified by the json-pointer attribute, will be created and the element will be added or nothing will be done and neither the path nor the element will be added to the JSON body

if-element-exists.description: Specifies whether the value of an existing element will be replaced or not

variable.description: Specifies the name of the variable from which to fetch the value to add to the path specified by the json-pointer attribute

replace-value.description: Replaces an element's old value with a new value specified in the value attribute

value.description: Specifies the new value that will replace the element's old value

replace-from-var-name.description: Replaces an element's old value with a new value that is stored on a variable

variable.description: Specifies the name of the variable from which to fetch the value that will replace the elementâ€™s old value

prepend-value.description: Prepends a string to an element's old value

value.description: Specifies the string value to be prepended to the element's old value

prepend-from-var-name.description: Prepends a string stored in a variable to an element's old value

variable.description: Specifies the name of the variable from which to fetch the string value to be prepended to the element's old value

append-value.description: Appends a string to an element's old value

value.description: Specifies the string value to be appended to the elements's old value

append-from-var-name.description: Appends a string stored in a variable to an element's old value

variable.description: Specifies the name of the variable from which to fetch the string value to be appended to the element's old value

search-replace-string.description: Searches for a string using the path specified by the json-pointer attribute. If the string is found in the JSON body, it is being replaced with the string specified using the configured options

case-sensitive.description: If true, the search operation will be perfomed in case sensitive mode.

full-match.description: If true, the search operation requires full match to proceed with the replace.

search-backwards.description: If true, the search operation will start from the end of the json body toward the top.

replace-all-occurrences.description: If true, the replace operation will be applied on all occurrences of the search item. Otherwise, only the first occurrence will be replaced

search-value.description: Specifies specific string as the search value

search-from-var-name.description: Specifies the variable name where the search string is stored.

replace-value.description: Specifies specific string as the replace value

replace-from-var-name.description: Specifies the variable name where the replace string is stored.

search-replace-regex.description: Searches for a pattern using the path specified by the json-pointer attribute. If the pattern matches in the JSON body, it is being replaced with the matched text specified using the configured options

search-regex.description: Specifies the regular expression used to search for string patterns.

replace-all-occurrences.description: If true, the replace operation will be applied on all occurrences of the search item. Otherwise, only the first occurrence will be replaced

replace-value.description: Specifies how the replacement will be performed based on the matched text as result of search-regex attribute. If the regular expression did not match, no replacement is applied.

replace-from-var-name.description: Specifies the variable name where the replace value is stored.

remove.description: Removes the element, including its contents if any, that is specified by the json-pointer attribute

action-create-json-body.description: Creates a valid JSON body from scratch

json-body.description: Specifies the entire JSON body that will be created

response-screening-case.description: Entry point to a list of screening rules which are evaluated in sequence on response messages

message-data-ref.description: Reference to defined message-data which has extracted the data to be used in screening rule conditions

screening-rule.description: The screening rules are evaluated in sequence once the response-screening-case is referenced

condition.description: A logical expression which is evaluated using the collected data from incoming responses as stored in message-data, and determines whether the screening-rule shall be executed. If no condition is defined, the screening-rule is always executed

screening-action.description: The screening-actions are executed in sequence once the condition of the screening-rule evaluates to true

action-add-header.description: Adds an HTTP header to a message

name.description: Specifies the header to be added to the response

if-exists.description: Defines the behavior when the header exists

value.description: Specifies the value of the header to be added to the response

action-modify-header.description: Either replaces the value of an existing HTTP header with a new one or prepends/appends a value to the existing value of a header

name.description: Specifies the header to be modified

replace-value.description: Specifies the value to replace the header's old value

replace-from-var-name.description: Specifies the name of the variable from which to fetch the value to replace the header's old value

prepend-value.description: Specifies the value to be prepended to the header's old value

prepend-from-var-name.description: Specifies the name of the variable from which to fetch the value to be prepended to the header's old value

append-value.description: Specifies the value to be appended to the header's old value

append-from-var-name.description: Specifies the name of the variable from which to fetch the value to be appended to the header's old value

action-remove-header.description: Removes an HTTP header from a message

name.description: Specifies the header to be removed from the response

action-exit-screening-case.description: Exits from a screening-case and terminates message screening processing

cause.description: The cause attribute in the json ProblemDetails element of HTTP error messages (according to TS 29.500).

detail.description: A human-readable explanation of the problem

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem

format.description: Format of the response message. The default is json

action-go-to.description: Jump to another response screening case

response-screening-case-ref.description: The name of the response-screening-case where the execution continues

action-log.description: Logs a user-defined message with the configured log-level

text.description: The text to be used for troubleshooting

max-log-message-length.description: Max length of action-log message; any message longer than the limit will be truncated and only the beginning up until the limit will be kept.

log-level.description: Define the log level for troubleshooting

replace-from-var-name.description: Specifies the variable name where the replace string is stored.

search-replace-regex.description: Searches for a pattern using the path specified by the json-pointer attribute. If the pattern matches in the JSON body, it is being replaced with the matched text specified using the configured options

search-regex.description: Specifies the regular expression used to search for string patterns.

replace-all-occurrences.description: If true, the replace operation will be applied on all occurrences of the search item. Otherwise, only the first occurrence will be replaced

replace-value.description: Specifies how the replacement will be performed based on the matched text as result of search-regex attribute. If the regular expression did not match, no replacement is applied.

replace-from-var-name.description: Specifies the variable name where the replace value is stored.

remove.description: Removes the element, including its contents if any, that is specified by the json-pointer attribute

action-create-json-body.description: Creates a valid JSON body from scratch

json-body.description: Specifies the entire JSON body that will be created

routing-case.description: Entry point to a list of routing rules which are evaluated in sequence

message-data-ref.description: Reference to defined message-data which has extracted the data to be used in routing rule conditions

condition.description: The evaluation of the condition determines, using the collected data from incoming requests, whether the actions in this routing rule shall be executed. If empty, the condition always evaluates to true

routing-action.description: Routing actions that are executed in sequence once the routing rule is used if the condition is true

slf-lookup-profile-ref.description: Specifies the slf-lookup-profile used for the SLF interrogation

action-nf-discovery.description: Perform delegated NF discovery by querying the NRF with the parameters from the received request.Specific discovery parameters or all the discovery parameters are extracted from the received request based on the configuration of either use-discovery-parameter or add-discovery-parameter.

nrf-group-ref.description: The group of NRFs providing the Nnrf_NFDiscovery service

request-timeout.description: The timeout of delegated discovery requests

endpoint-ip-family.description: IP family of the discovered endpoints to be used. Applicable only when FQDN is not present.

use-discovery-parameter.description: Discovery parameters from the received request that are used in the delegated discovery

use-selected.description: Explicitly selected discovery parameters from the received request that are used in the delegated discovery

name.description: The selected discovery parameter to use in the delegated discovery

use-all.description: Use all discovery parameters present in the received request when performing delegated discovery.

add-discovery-parameter.description: Discovery parameters and values to be used in addition or instead of the parameters from the received request

value.description: The specific value of the discovery parameter. Strings as well as valid JSON data structures are allowed

from-var-name.description: The name of the variable that holds the discovery parameter's value

nf-selection-on-priority.description: From the discovered list of NF-profiles, choose one NF from those with the highest priority and store it as the preferred host in the variable given in â€˜variable-name-selected-hostâ€™. The nf-set-if of the chosen host is stored in the variable given in â€˜variable-name-nfsetâ€™.

variable-name-selected-host.description: The name of the variable used for storing the host name:port of the selected NF

variable-name-nfset.description: The name of the variable used for storing the nf-set-id of the selected NF

action-route-strict.description: Route strictly to the targeted host

keep-authority-header.description: If present, keep the authority header of the request without modifying

preserve-if-indirect-routing.description: Selected attributes value to preserve in case of indirect routing

target-nf-pool.description: Route via the referenced configured nf-pool or variable that holds the nf-pool name

var-name.description: Variable that holds the pool name

nf-pool-ref.description: Name of the referenced configured nf-pool

from-var-name.description: Route the request based on the defined variable

from-target-api-root-header.description: If present, route the request based on the target-api-root-header's value

from-authority-header.description: If present, route the request based on the authority-header's value

action-route-preferred.description: Route to the targeted host which belongs to the specified nf-pool. In case of failure, re-select among the rest of the hosts in this nf-pool

keep-authority-header.description: If present, keep the authority header of the request without modifying

preserve-if-indirect-routing.description: Selected attribute's value to preserve in case of indirect routing

preserve-disc-param-if-indirect.description: The discovery parameters of the received request to preserve in case of indirect routing. By default no parameters are preserved

preserve-selected.description: List of specific discovery parameters to preserve in the request before forwarding it to the next-hop SCP or SEPP

name.description: The discovery parameter to preserve in the request

preserve-all.description: Preserve all discovery parameters in the request before forwarding it to the next-hop SCP or SEPP

target-nf-pool.description: Route via the referenced configured nf-pool or variable that holds the nf-pool name

var-name.description: Variable that holds the pool name

nf-pool-ref.description: Name of the referenced configured nf-pool

last-resort-nf-pool-ref.description: Last nf-pool of hosts to try in case of multiple failures

from-var-name.description: Route the request based on the defined variable

from-target-api-root-header.description: If present, route the request based on the target-api-root-header's value

from-authority-header.description: If present, route the request based on the authority-header's value

action-route-round-robin.description: Route indirectly in a round-robin fashion. Set the target-apiRoot header to the selected target, based on the result of the preceding nf-discovery action. The target-apiRoot header is replaced for every reselection to another target.

keep-authority-header.description: If present, keep the authority header of the request without modifying

preserve-if-indirect-routing.description: Selected attribute's value to preserve in case of indirect routing

preserve-disc-param-if-indirect.description: The discovery parameters of the received request to preserve in case of indirect routing. By default no parameters are preserved

preserve-selected.description: List of specific discovery parameters to preserve in the request before forwarding it to the next-hop SCP or SEPP

name.description: The discovery parameter to preserve in the request

preserve-all.description: Preserve all discovery parameters in the request before forwarding it to the next-hop SCP or SEPP

target-nf-pool.description: Route via the referenced configured nf-pool or variable that holds the nf-pool name

var-name.description: Variable that holds the pool name

nf-pool-ref.description: Name of the referenced configured nf-pool

last-resort-nf-pool-ref.description: Last nf-pool of hosts to try in case of multiple failures

action-route-remote-round-robin.description: Select the host name to include in the target-api-root header and route the request to any of the hosts in the specified target-nf-pool. The target-api-root header is replaced on reselects in a round-robin fashion.

preserve-disc-param-if-indirect.description: The discovery parameters of the received request to preserve in case of indirect routing. By default no parameters are preserved

preserve-selected.description: List of specific discovery parameters to preserve in the request before forwarding it to the next-hop SCP or SEPP

name.description: The discovery parameter to preserve in the request

preserve-all.description: Preserve all discovery parameters in the request before forwarding it to the next-hop SCP or SEPP

target-nf-pool.description: Route via the referenced configured nf-pool or variable that holds the nf-pool name

var-name.description: Variable that holds the pool name

nf-pool-ref.description: Name of the referenced configured nf-pool

last-resort-nf-pool-ref.description: Last nf-pool of hosts to try in case of multiple failures

action-route-remote-preferred.description: Route indirectly to the preferred host as specified in the target-api-root-header. In cases where a re-selection of the target is needed, select the host name to include in the target-api-root header based on the result of the preceding nf-discovery action. The target-api-root header is replaced in a round-robin fashion for every subsequent re-selection

preserve-if-indirect-routing.description: Selected attribute's value to preserve in case of indirect routing

preserve-disc-param-if-indirect.description: The discovery parameters of the received request to preserve in case of indirect routing. By default no parameters are preserved

preserve-selected.description: List of specific discovery parameters to preserve in the request before forwarding it to the next-hop SCP or SEPP

name.description: The discovery parameter to preserve in the request

preserve-all.description: Preserve all discovery parameters in the request before forwarding it to the next-hop SCP or SEPP

target-nf-pool.description: Route via the referenced configured nf-pool or variable that holds the nf-pool name

var-name.description: Variable that holds the pool name

nf-pool-ref.description: Name of the referenced configured nf-pool

last-resort-nf-pool-ref.description: Last nf-pool of hosts to try in case of multiple failures

from-target-api-root-header.description: If present, route the request based on the target-api-root-header's value

action-reject-message.description: Rejects an http request and sends back a response with an operator defined status code and title with detailed explanation

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem

cause.description: The cause attribute in the json ProblemDetails element of HTTP error messages (according to TS 29.500).

detail.description: A human-readable explanation of the problem. Only used when the format attribute has the value 'json'

format.description: Format of the error message. If the default value 'json' is used, the response body is formatted according to RFC 7807. If the format value used is 'text', a header 'content-type: text/plain' is added in the response body and only the value of the title attribute is stored

action-log.description: Logs a user-defined message with the configured log-level

text.description: The text to be used for troubleshooting

max-log-message-length.description: Max length of action-log message; any message longer than the limit will be truncated and only the beginning up until the limit will be kept.

log-level.description: Define the log level for troubleshooting

action-drop-message.description: Drops an http request message and the HTTP/2 stream is reset gracefully

static-nf-instance-data.description: Statically defined NF instances to be referenced in a nf-pool

name.description: Name of the static NF instance data set

static-nf-instance.description: Static NF instances in this data set

static-nf-service.description: The service for which an NF has registered

capacity.description: Specifies the capacity of this service

priority.description: The priority of the service. Lower values indicate a higher priority

set-id.description: The set identity of the service

address.description: Address of the service, at least one of FQDN or IPv4 or IPv6 address must be given

fqdn.description: FQDN of the service. According to RFC 1035 only letters, digits and hyphen (-) are allowed.

inter-plmn-fqdn.description: FQDN of the service used for inter-PLMN routing. According to RFC 1035 only letters, digits and hyphen (-) are allowed.

multiple-ip-endpoint.description: Multiple IP endpoint(s) of the service, all with the same port and transport

name.description: Human readable name of the NF

nf-type.description: The type of the NF (according to TS 29.510)

locality.description: The geographic locality of the NF

nf-set-id.description: The set identity of the NF

scp-domain.description: The SCP domains this NF is associated with

static-scp-instance-data.description: Statically defined SCP instances to be referenced in a nf-pool

name.description: Name of the static SCP instance data set

static-scp-instance.description: Static SCP instances in this data set

served-nf-set-id.description: The set identity of the NFs served by the SCP

static-nf-service.description: The service for which the SCP has registered

capacity.description: Specifies the capacity of this service

priority.description: The priority of the service. Lower values indicate a higher priority

set-id.description: The set identity of the service

address.description: Address of the service, at least one of FQDN or IPv4 or IPv6 address must be given

fqdn.description: FQDN of the service. According to RFC 1035 only letters, digits and hyphen (-) are allowed.

inter-plmn-fqdn.description: FQDN of the service used for inter-PLMN routing. According to RFC 1035 only letters, digits and hyphen (-) are allowed.

multiple-ip-endpoint.description: Multiple IP endpoint(s) of the service, all with the same port and transport

static-scp-domain-info.description: The info about the static scp domain

name.description: Name identifying the static scp domain

capacity.description: Specifies the capacity of this service

priority.description: The priority of the service. Lower values indicate a higher priority

address.description: Address of the service, at least one of FQDN or IPv4 or IPv6 address must be given

fqdn.description: FQDN of the service. According to RFC 1035 only letters, digits and hyphen (-) are allowed.

multiple-ip-endpoint.description: Multiple IP endpoint(s) of the service, all with the same port and transport

name.description: Human readable name of the NF

nf-type.description: The type of the NF (according to TS 29.510)

locality.description: The geographic locality of the NF

nf-set-id.description: The set identity of the NF

scp-domain.description: The SCP domains this NF is associated with

static-sepp-instance-data.description: Statically defined SEPP instances to be referenced in an nf-pool

name.description: Name of the static SEPP instance data set

static-sepp-instance.description: Static SEPP instances in this data set

capacity.description: Specifies the capacity of this static sepp instance

priority.description: The priority of the static sepp instance. Lower values indicate a higher priority

address.description: Address of the static sepp instance, at least one of FQDN or IPv4 or IPv6 address must be given

fqdn.description: FQDN of the static sepp instance. According to RFC 1035 only letters, digits and hyphen (-) are allowed.

multiple-ip-endpoint.description: Multiple IP endpoint(s) of the static sepp instance, all with the same port and transport

name.description: Human readable name of the NF

nf-type.description: The type of the NF (according to TS 29.510)

locality.description: The geographic locality of the NF

nf-set-id.description: The set identity of the NF

scp-domain.description: The SCP domains this NF is associated with

nf-pool.description: Grouping of defined or dynamically discovered NF instances

dns-profile-ref.description: Reference to a defined dns-profile that will be used for DNS resolution on producers of this nf-pool. This setting overrides the global setting.

enable-stats-per-nf-instance.description: If set to true, then counters per NF instance are activated

threshold-for-nf-unavailable-alarm.description: Threshold for the number of 5xx errors and timeouts received within 15 seconds time interval, that lead to raising the alarm: SCP, NF Instance Unavailable

add-non-matching-as-lowest-priority.description: If true, last priority-group is created with non-matching instances or endpoints.

nf-match-condition.description: Only the NF instances that satisfy the nf-match-condition are included in the NF pool. Applicable only to dynamically discovered NF instances

scp-match-condition.description: Only the SCP instances that satisfy the scp-match-condition are included in the NF pool. Applicable only to dynamically discovered SCP instances

nf-pool-discovery.description: Attributes to define discovery and grouping of NF instances

nrf-query.description: NRF queries used to discover NF instances that then get stored in attribute discovered-nf-instance of this nf-pool

requester-nf-type.description: The NF type of the requester NF (according to TS 29.510)

nf-type.description: The NF type of the targeted NF (according to TS 29.510)

nf-set-id.description: The set identity of the targeted NF

nf-service-set-id.description: The set identity of the targeted NF service

preferred-locality.description: The preferred locality of the targeted NF

requester-plmn.description: The PLMN identity of the requester NF. Format: MCC (3 digits) followed by MNC (2 or 3 digits). Example for MCC=123 and MNC=45: 12345

requester-snssai.description: Slice info of the requester NF

sst.description: Specifies the slice service type of the S-NSSAI

sd.description: Specifies the slice differentiator of the S-NSSAI. Special character '-' indicates an unspecified slice differentiator

scp-domain.description: The SCP domain the target NF or SCP belongs to

service-name.description: The name of the service offered by the targeted NF

query-parameter.description: Custom query parameter used for parameters not covered by non-custom attributes in nrf-query. Query parameter names already covered may not be used. Apart from this, possible name and value are according to TS 29.510

static-nf-instance-data-ref.description: Reference to a list of statically configured NF instances

update-interval.description: Time span between two nf-pool updates. Use special value infinite to stop regular nf-pool updates

last-update.description: Date and time of the last update of the discovered NF instances in this nf-pool

discovered-nf-instance.description: Discovered NF instances in this nf-pool

discovered-nf-service.description: The service for which an NF has registered

capacity.description: Specifies the capacity of this service

priority.description: The priority of the service. Lower values indicate a higher priority

set-id.description: The set identity of the service

address.description: Address of the service, at least one of FQDN or IPv4 or IPv6 address must be given

fqdn.description: FQDN of the service. According to RFC 1035 only letters, digits and hyphen (-) are allowed.

inter-plmn-fqdn.description: FQDN of the service used for inter-PLMN routing. According to RFC 1035 only letters, digits and hyphen (-) are allowed.

multiple-ip-endpoint.description: Multiple IP endpoint(s) of the service, all with the same port and transport

name.description: Human readable name of the NF

nf-type.description: The type of the NF (according to TS 29.510)

locality.description: The geographic locality of the NF

nf-set-id.description: The set identity of the NF

scp-domain.description: The SCP domains this NF is associated with

discovered-scp-instance.description: Discovered SCP instances in this nf-pool

served-nf-set-id.description: The set identity of the NFs served by the SCP

discovered-scp-domain-info.description: The info about the discovered scp domain

name.description: Name identifying the discovered scp domain

capacity.description: Specifies the capacity of this service

priority.description: The priority of the service. Lower values indicate a higher priority

address.description: Address of the service, at least one of FQDN or IPv4 or IPv6 address must be given

fqdn.description: FQDN of the service. According to RFC 1035 only letters, digits and hyphen (-) are allowed.

multiple-ip-endpoint.description: Multiple IP endpoint(s) of the service, all with the same port and transport

name.description: Human readable name of the NF

nf-type.description: The type of the NF (according to TS 29.510)

locality.description: The geographic locality of the NF

nf-set-id.description: The set identity of the NF

scp-domain.description: The SCP domains this NF is associated with

priority-group.description: Group of NF instances that satisfy specific selection criteria and belong to the same priority

priority.description: The priority assigned to the group of NF instances, with a lower value indicating higher priority

static-scp-instance-data-ref.description: Reference to an SCP instance data set

static-sepp-instance-data-ref.description: Reference to a SEPP instance data set

nf-match-condition.description: NF instances of this nf-pool which satisfy the nf-match-condition are prioritized according to priority-group priority

scp-match-condition.description: SCP instances of this nf-pool which satisfy the scp-match-condition are prioritized according to priority-group priority

sepp-match-condition.description: SEPP instances of this nf-pool which satisfy the sepp-match-condition are prioritized according to priority-group priority

static-scp-instance-data-ref.description: Reference to an SCP instance data set

static-sepp-instance-data-ref.description: Reference to a SEPP instance data set

pool-retry-budget.description: Specifies a limit per pool on concurrent retries in relation to the number of active requests

concurrent-retries-percentage.description: Specifies the limit on concurrent retries as a percentage of the sum of active requests and active pending requests.For example, if there are 100 active requests and the budget_percent is set to 25, there may be 25 active retries

min-concurrent-retries.description: Specifies the minimum retry concurrency allowed for the retry budget. The limit on the number of active retries may never go below this number.

temporary-blocking.description: Temporary blocking allows the dynamic blocking of NFs which are not reachable, based on configurable and preset attributes

blocking-time.description: The duration of time for which a NF is blocked

consecutive-failures.description: The number of consecutive 5xx errors from a NF node before it is temporarily blocked. If consecutive-local-failures parameter is not configured, then this value also represents the locally originated failures

consecutive-local-failures.description: The number of consecutive locally originated failures per worker pod before an NF is temporary blocked. If this parameter is configured, then the locally originated failures are counted separately from the consecutive 5xx errors for temporary blocking. If this parameter is set to zero then locally originated failures do not lead to temporary blocking in this pool

consecutive-gateway-failures.description: The number of consecutive gateway failures (502, 503, 504 status codes) before a consecutive gateway failure ejection occurs. If this parameter is configured, then the consecutive gateway failures are counted separately from the consecutive 5xx errors for temporary blocking. If this parameter is set to zero then consecutive gateway failures do not lead to temporary blocking in this pool

out-request-screening-case-ref.description: Reference to the request screening case that is applied when the request is targeting an NF instance in this nf-pool

in-response-screening-case-ref.description: Reference to the response screening case that is applied when the response is received from an NF instance in this nf-pool

failover-profile.description: Determines the failover behaviour in case of failure such as lack of response or error response from peer

request-time-budget.description: The maximum time in milliseconds a single request is allowed to take including retries, before SEPP considers it as timed out. The time starts when the request enters the SCP Worker and ends when the response leaves the SCP Worker. It includes the time for an SLF-lookup if one is required.

http-status.description: HTTP Status codes to trigger a retry

reset.description: If defined, retry when the peer does not respond at all

connect-failure.description: If defined, retry in case of connection timeout or connection refused

refused-stream.description: If defined, retry in case of response HTTP2 REFUSED_STREAM received from peer

target-timeout.description: Specifies the maximum time in milliseconds a single request towards a specific target is allowed to take before considered to be timed out

preferred-host-retries-max.description: Specifies the number of times to perform a retry to the preferred host

preferred-host-retry-multiple-addresses.description: Retry multiple addresses of preferred host. If set to true, retries will be spread across all addresses of the selected host.

target-nf-pool-reselects-max.description: Specifies the number of reselects to perform among the hosts of the target-nf-pool

last-resort-nf-pool-reselects-max.description: Specifies the number of reselects to perform among the hosts of the last-resort nf-pool

nf-profile.description: Profile consisting of general parameters of the SCP instance and the services exposed by it, sent to the NRF at registration

service-address-ref.description: Service address on which the SCP listens for incoming requests

associated-nf-pool-ref.description: Reference to the associated nf-pool to be considered at NRF registration for discovered NF instances capacity aggregation. If it is not present, the configured capacity will be used instead.

chf-info.description: Specific data for the CHF NF

supi-range.description: Specifies the list of ranges of SUPIs that can be served by the CHF instance. If not specified, the CHF can serve any SUPI

id.description: ID uniquely identifying the SUPI range

supi-start.description: First value identifying the start of a SUPI range, to be used when the range of SUPI's can be represented as a numeric range, IMSI ranges for example. This string shall consist only of digits.

supi-end.description: Last value identifying the end of a SUPI range, to be used when the range of SUPI's can be represented as a numeric range, IMSI ranges for example. This string shall consist only of digits.

pattern.description: Regular expression pattern representing the set of SUPIs belonging to this range. A SUPI value is considered part of the range if, and only if, the SUPI string fully matches the regular expression.

gpsi-range.description: Specifies the list of ranges of GPSIs that can be served by the CHF instance. If not specified, the CHF can serve any GPSI

identity-start.description: First value identifying the start of an identity range, to be used when the range of identities can be represented as a numeric range, MSISDN ranges for example. This string shall consist only of digits.

identity-end.description: Last value identifying the end of an identity range, to be used when the range of identities can be represented as a numeric range, MSISDN ranges for example. This string shall consist only of digits.

pattern.description: Regular expression pattern representing the set of identities belonging to this range. An identity value is considered part of the range if and only if the identity string fully matches the regular expression. To be used when identity is External Identifier or External Group Identifier or MSISDN.

plmn-range.description: Specifies the list of ranges of PLMNs that can be served by the CHF instance. If not specified, the CHF can serve any PLMN

plmn-start.description: First value identifying the start of a PLMN range. The string shall be encoded as follows: <MCC><MNC>. For example '12340'.

plmn-end.description: Last value identifying the end of a PLMN range. The string shall be encoded as follows: <MCC><MNC>. For example '12349'.

pattern.description: Regular expression pattern representing the set of PLMNs belonging to this range. A PLMN value is considered part of the range if and only if the PLMN string, formatted as <MCC><MNC>, fully matches the regular expression. For example '^1234[0-9]$'

scp-info.description: Specific data for the SCP NF

scp-prefix.description: Optional deployment-specific string used to construct the apiRoot of this SCP

ipv4-address.description: IPv4 address reachable through the SCP

ipv6-prefix.description: IPv6 prefix reachable through the SCP

ipv4-addr-range.description: IPv4 address range reachable through the SCP

ipv6-prefix-range.description: IPv6 prefix range reachable through the SCP

served-nf-set-id.description: The set identity of the NF served by the SCP

address-domain.description: Address domain name(s) reachable through the SCP

remote-plmn.description: Remote PLMN(s) reachable through the SCP

mcc.description: Specifies the mobile country code of the PLMN

mnc.description: Specifies the mobile network code of the PLMN

scp-capabilities.description: If present, scp capabilities are published in nrf during registration. If present but no scp capabilities are defined, then an empty array is sent to NRF.

indirect-com-with-deleg-disc.description: If true, scp has the capability for delegated discovery support

ip-reachability.description: Type of IP addresses reachable through the SCP in the SCP domain(s) it belongs to

scp-domain-info.description: SCP domain specific information of the SCP

scp-domain-ref.description: Reference to a defined SCP domain

scp-prefix.description: Optional deployment-specific string used to construct the apiRoot of this SCP

nf-service.description: The configuration of NF services, proxied through the SCP NF instance, which can be discovered by other NFs

service-version.description: The supported versions of this NF service. Detailed information on the default versions used can be found in CPI document 'Configuring the SCP'.

api-version-in-uri.description: Version of the service instance to be used in the URI for accessing the API

api-full-version.description: Full version number of the API

service-address-ref.description: Service address on which the SCP listens for incoming requests

service-instance-id.description: Name uniquely identifying this service instance.

service-name.description: Name identifying the type of NF service.

api-prefix.description: Optional path used to construct the API URI for this service

allowed-plmn.description: PLMNs allowed to access the NF instance. If not specified, NFs of any PLMN are allowed to access the NF

mcc.description: Specifies the mobile country code of the PLMN

mnc.description: Specifies the mobile network code of the PLMN

allowed-nf-type.description: NF types (according to TS 29.510) which are allowed to access the NF service. If not specified, NFs of any type are allowed to access the NF service.

allowed-nf-domain.description: NF domain names which are allowed to access the NF service. If not specified, If not specified, NFs in any domain are allowed to access the NF

allowed-nssai.description: Deprecated, use allowed-nssai-1 instead. NSSAIs which are allowed to access the NF instance. If not specified, NFs in any NSSAI are allowed to access the NF

sst.description: Specifies the slice service type of the S-NSSAI

sd.description: Specifies the optional slice differentiator of the S-NSSAI

allowed-nssai-1.description: NSSAIs which are allowed to access the NF instance. If not specified, NFs in any NSSAI are allowed to access the NF

sst.description: Specifies the slice service type of the S-NSSAI

sd.description: Specifies the slice differentiator of the S-NSSAI. Special character '-' indicates an unspecified slice differentiator

service-priority.description: Service priority of this NF service relative to other NF services of the same type, to be used for NF service selection. Lower values indicate a higher priority

capacity.description: Static capacity information of this NF service expressed as a weight relative to other services of the same type, to be used for NF selection

recovery-time.description: Timestamp when the NF was (re)started - This attribute is not used.

nf-instance-name.description: Human readable name of the NF instance

nf-type.description: The type of the NF instance (according to TS 29.510)

nf-specific-info.description: Deprecated, use nf-profile->chf-info and nf-profile->bsf-info instead, specific data for the NF instance type

chf-info.description: Specific data for the CHF NF

supi-range.description: Specifies the list of ranges of SUPIs that can be served by the CHF instance. If not specified, the CHF can serve any SUPI

id.description: ID uniquely identifying the SUPI range

supi-start.description: First value identifying the start of a SUPI range, to be used when the range of SUPI's can be represented as a numeric range, IMSI ranges for example. This string shall consist only of digits.

supi-end.description: Last value identifying the end of a SUPI range, to be used when the range of SUPI's can be represented as a numeric range, IMSI ranges for example. This string shall consist only of digits.

pattern.description: Regular expression pattern representing the set of SUPIs belonging to this range. A SUPI value is considered part of the range if, and only if, the SUPI string fully matches the regular expression.

gpsi-range.description: Specifies the list of ranges of GPSIs that can be served by the CHF instance. If not specified, the CHF can serve any GPSI

identity-start.description: First value identifying the start of an identity range, to be used when the range of identities can be represented as a numeric range, MSISDN ranges for example. This string shall consist only of digits.

identity-end.description: Last value identifying the end of an identity range, to be used when the range of identities can be represented as a numeric range, MSISDN ranges for example. This string shall consist only of digits.

pattern.description: Regular expression pattern representing the set of identities belonging to this range. An identity value is considered part of the range if and only if the identity string fully matches the regular expression. To be used when identity is External Identifier or External Group Identifier or MSISDN.

plmn-range.description: Specifies the list of ranges of PLMNs that can be served by the CHF instance. If not specified, the CHF can serve any PLMN

plmn-start.description: First value identifying the start of a PLMN range. The string shall be encoded as follows: <MCC><MNC>. For example '12340'.

plmn-end.description: Last value identifying the end of a PLMN range. The string shall be encoded as follows: <MCC><MNC>. For example '12349'.

pattern.description: Regular expression pattern representing the set of PLMNs belonging to this range. A PLMN value is considered part of the range if and only if the PLMN string, formatted as <MCC><MNC>, fully matches the regular expression. For example '^1234[0-9]$'

bsf-info.description: Specific data for the BSF NF

requested-heartbeat-timer.description: Requested time, in seconds, expected between two heart-beat messages from the NF instance to the NRF

plmn.description: PLMN(s) of the NF instance. If not provided, the PLMN ID(s) of the PLMN of the NRF are assumed for this NF

mcc.description: Specifies the mobile country code of the PLMN

mnc.description: Specifies the mobile network code of the PLMN

snssai.description: Deprecated, use snssai-1 instead. S-NSSAIs of the NF instance. If present, this attribute represents the list of S-NSSAIs supported in all the PLMNs configured for this NF instance. If not provided, the NF instance can serve any S-NSSAI

sst.description: Specifies the slice service type of the S-NSSAI

sd.description: Specifies the optional slice differentiator of the S-NSSAI

snssai-1.description: S-NSSAIs of the NF instance. If present, this attribute represents the list of S-NSSAIs supported in all the PLMNs configured for this NF instance. If not provided, the NF instance can serve any S-NSSAI

sst.description: Specifies the slice service type of the S-NSSAI

sd.description: Specifies the slice differentiator of the S-NSSAI. Special character '-' indicates an unspecified slice differentiator

allowed-plmn.description: PLMNs allowed to access the NF instance. If not specified, NFs of any PLMN are allowed to access the NF

mcc.description: Specifies the mobile country code of the PLMN

mnc.description: Specifies the mobile network code of the PLMN

allowed-nf-type.description: NF types (according to TS 29.510) which are allowed to access the NF instance. If not specified, NFs of any type are allowed to access the NF

allowed-nf-domain.description: NF domain names which are allowed to access the NF instance. If not specified, NFs in any domain are allowed to access the NF

allowed-nssai.description: Deprecated, use allowed-nssai-1 instead. NSSAIs which are allowed to access the NF instance. If not specified, NFs in any NSSAI are allowed to access the NF

sst.description: Specifies the slice service type of the S-NSSAI

sd.description: Specifies the optional slice differentiator of the S-NSSAI

allowed-nssai-1.description: NSSAIs which are allowed to access the NF instance. If not specified, NFs in any NSSAI are allowed to access the NF

sst.description: Specifies the slice service type of the S-NSSAI

sd.description: Specifies the slice differentiator of the S-NSSAI. Special character '-' indicates an unspecified slice differentiator

nf-set-id.description: NF Set Identifiers for this NF used for NF registration

nsi.description: NSI identities of the Network Function. If not provided, the NF can serve any NSI

service-priority.description: Service priority of this NF instance, in the range of 0-65535, relative to other NF instances of the same type, to be used for NF selection. Lower values indicate a higher priority

capacity.description: Static capacity information of this NF instance, in the range of 0-65535, expressed as a weight relative to other NF instances of the same type

locality.description: Operator defined information about the location of the NF instance. This information can be used by requesting NFs which prefer services of those NFs in the same geographical location or data center

recovery-time.description: Timestamp when the NF was (re)started - This attribute is not used.

scp-domain.description: The SCP domain(s) the SCP belongs to or the SCP domain the NF (other than SCP) belongs to

nrf-group.description: The NRF group specifies all relevant information of NRFs that are available to this SCP instance. Regarding the Nnrf_NFManagement interface, it determines the NRF registration behavior and triggers the NRF registration for the NF instance specified in the nf-profile

name.description: Name identifying the NRF registration group

nf-instance-id.description: ID uniquely identifying the NF Profile of this SCP instance, given per NRF Group

nf-profile-ref.description: The NF profile with which to register to the NRF for the Nnrf_NFManagement service. If specified, the attributes configured in the NF profile on NRF level will override the corresponding attributes of the NF profile on NRF group level

dns-profile-ref.description: Reference to a defined dns-profile that will be used for DNS resolution of the FQDN of the NRFs in the NRF group

nrf.description: The configuration for a single NRF within this NRF group

nf-profile-ref.description: The NF profile with which to register to the NRF for the Nnrf_NFManagement service. If specified, the attributes configured in the NF profile on the individual NRF level will override the corresponding attributes of the NF profile on the NRF group level

priority.description: Priority of this NRF for NF registration and other NRF service requests, relative to other NRFs in the same NRF group. In regard to the Nnrf_NFManagement service, the NRF with the highest priority is the primary NRF to which the NF instance will register. The remaining NRFs are used in case of failover, in order of priority. Lower values indicate a higher priority.

scheme.description: Specifies the URI scheme to be used when contacting this NRF

retry-timeout.description: The time duration in milliseconds after which a request is considered unsuccessful and a retry to the same NRF is sent.

max-retries.description: The number of retries sent to the same NRF before failover to another NRF.

nrf-instance-id.description: NRF instance id uniquely identifying the NRF

nrf-service.description: Defines which NRF services are used by this NF instance, referencing groups of NRFs that provide the respective service

nf-management.description: Triggers the registration of this NF instance towards NRF and the usage of the Nnrf_NfManagement service

nrf-group-ref.description: The groups of NRFs providing the Nnrf_NFManagement service

nf-discovery.description: Enables the usage of the Nnrf_NfDiscovery service

nrf-group-ref.description: The group of NRFs providing the Nnrf_NFDiscovery service
